definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: I had two questions, one more general.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个问题，一个略为笼统些。

sentences.english: The patient became a bit better after taking some medicine.
For this reason, a slender and restricted diet is generally more dangerous than one a little more liberal.
sentences.chinese: 因此，过分限制饮食通常比略为随意地限制更加危险。

sentences.english: The cashier, a man a bit younger than Mr. Karras.
sentences.chinese: 那个比卡拉斯先生略为年轻一点的收银员。

sentences.english: The letter alludes to something now forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 这封信略为提到某些现已被忘记了的事情。

sentences.english: The surf's roar was here dulled .
sentences.chinese: 拍岸浪的咆哮声在这儿略为低沉。

sentences.english: Altair is not as bright as Vega and Deneb.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛星与织女和天津四相比，光亮度还是略为逊色。

sentences.english: The import bill was also reduced slightly by a drop in the price of crude oil.
sentences.chinese: 总进口额则因原油价格下滑而略为降低。

sentences.english: The mild stimulant makes the hardships of life in Mogadishu feel more bearable.
sentences.chinese: 这种淡味的刺激物使得摩加迪沙生活的艰难略为好过。

sentences.english: Their aphelion points are just a little outside of Jupiter's orbit.
sentences.chinese: 这两轨道的远日点，都只略为超出木星轨道一些。

definition: to be abbreviated to/(followed by a verb) slightly
more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)
